text: I stand in front of you a complete rice
idiot rice is my kryptonite
so I set out to figure out how to make
one great bowl of rice I didn't want to
use a rice cooker because I don't want
another gadget and if you can make rice
in a pot you can make it in any kitchen
and you can make a thousand great
recipes okay here we go there are seven
hundred and twelve million varieties of
rice in the world okay
there's not that many but there's a lot
there's long grain and short grain sushi
rice basmati rice rice from Thailand
rice from Persia rice from Africa
there's rice everywhere in the world and
it seems like everyone in the world
knows how to cook it everyone except me
okay I brought home some Carolina gold
this is an heirloom variety that they're
bringing back in South Carolina which
was the first rice growing region in the
country it's a lovely lovely nutty long
grain rice and I'm looking forward to
cooking it up my formula starts with
about a half a cup of dried rice per
person you want to rinse the rice really
well to get the starch out of it also
makes the rice kind of plump we want
about a half a teaspoon of butter let
that brown up just a touch so we have a
cup of long grain rice 2 cups of water
half a teaspoon of salt
we're gonna let that come to a boil
water's boiling now here's my trick this
baby is going in a 350 degree oven for
17 minutes okay out of the oven and now
comes the hard part you have to wait for
10 minutes so the steam will absorb into
the rice and this is the part that is
really hard for me
and now the big reveal it's been 10
minutes look at that it's beautiful
fluff it up perfect perfect
and remember what modern Joffrey said
about grains of rice they should be like
brothers close but not stuck together
Oh
